TopicTitle: Please re-enable vertical snap capabilities in the construction buildings

Articles.Content:
I have been a huge fan of the editor extensions mod, so I'm glad to see some love for the construction facilities in 0.9. Unfortunately we've also lost something. There used to be a "vertical snap" feature exposed by the game but not implemented in the editor. This allowed you to perfectly center-align surface attached parts. For example, you could make sure that two of the same fuel tanks had perfectly aligned ends. The editor extensions mod enabled that functionality and I used it extensively, but apparently in 0.9 it is no longer exposed by the game.

Please bring it back so that EE can use it even if it's not implemented in the stock editor. The EE author is valiantly trying to build a workaround but this would be so much simpler.

I agree, it's massively useful... it's great for balancing asparagus engines when you do them in 2x symmetry, along with many other applications. I don't want to play without EE, and because of that, and other reasons, I'm still playing 0.25.

This can actually be accomplished using the offset gizmo. With angle snap switched on it snaps to increments, although it is a little inconsistent sometimes about where those increments are. Usually playing with the parent-relative/absolute modes solves that though (switching this is bound to F).
It might be possible with some fiddling, but the point of vertical snap is that it eliminates all the fiddling.
Oh wow, is there no vertical snap anymore? What a huge downer. Yeah, bring it back, Squad.

I always disliked vertical snap before because it forced one single snap point and not multiple ones. I'd rather "fiddle" and get it the way I want than to have it snap somewhere and I'd have to live with it.

I've not yet had the problem where gizmos don't snap correctly. Usually I just have to turn them on and just grab the vertical arrow of each part to get them to snap to the correct location. This (for the above reason) is far preferable to me to a forced snap to the very center.

Of course, I have no problem with it being implemented for those who want it.
